properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds, with gusts at times reaching 100 km/h, will weaken overnight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected beginning Sunday night. Total snowfall: 10 cm or more. Locations: Northwestern New Brunswick. Time span: Sunday night through Monday morning. Remarks: A low pressure system will approach from the west on Sunday. Snow will develop ahead of the low Sunday night and persist into Monday morning. The snow will be wet and mixed at times with rain, freezing rain or ice pellets. Current indications suggest that total snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-15T00:54:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-14T08:55:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2370471833.2020
Area: Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Colorado low will intensify over New England and affect Eastern Quebec Sunday and Monday. This storm will bring snow at times heavy, strong to high winds and even rain. Snowfall amounts could exceed 15 centimetres over several areas. Over the tip of the Gaspé Peninsula and Anticosti Island, precipitation will mainly fall as rain. Rainfall amounts between 20 and 30 millimetres are expected there. Southeasterly winds could gust from 70 to 90 kilometres per hour over the tip of the Gaspé Peninsula and the Lower North Shore on Monday. The strong winds combined with the fact that we are currently in a period of high tidal ranges may produce breaking sea conditions at Gaspé-Percé, on Anticosti Island and on the Lower North Shore Monday afternoon. Given the complexity of this system, it is still too early to determine the expected amounts of precipitation and the regions that will be the most affected. More information on this system's development will be provided as it becomes available. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-14T19:27:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-14T03:28:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4164952292.2020

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected today. Snow combined with gusts reaching 70 kilometres per hour will reduce visibilities to near zero. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-15T00:45:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-14T08:46:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1604999156.2020
Area: Ivujivik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow continue. In Sachs Harbour, 4 to 8 cm of falling snow and strong winds, with gusts up to 70 km/h, will cause blizzard conditions to continue through tonight and Saturday. Blizzard conditions are expected to end by Sunday morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-14T20:32:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-14T04:33:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3024740856.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific storm moving across the BC interior will continue to bring heavy snow to Elk Valley region tonight. Approximately 27 cm of snow has already fallen in Sparwood since last night. Additional snowfall amounts of 15 cm can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries early Saturday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-14T14:35:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-13T22:36:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4220241973.2020
Area: Elk Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific storm moving across the BC interior will continue to bring periods of heavy snow to Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass tonight. Approximately 30 cm of snow has fallen since last night. Additional snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries early Saturday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-14T14:38:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-13T22:39:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3671017755.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall is expected over some areas. Total snowfall: 10 to 20 cm. Locations: mainly inland sections of eastern Newfoundland. Time span: This afternoon until Sunday morning. Remarks: The highest snowfall amounts can be expected inland and over higher terrain. Most coastal areas should see much lower snowfall amounts as the snow occasionally mixes with or changes to rain. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-11-15T00:42:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-14T08:43:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2643466834.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Burin Peninsula, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Heavy snow will persist over the Coquihalla Highway from Hope to Merritt tonight as a Pacific storm continues moving across the BC interior. Approximately 35 cm of snow has fallen since last night. Additional snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm can be expected by Saturday morning. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
